Labrador Retriever.description: Friendly, outgoing, and high-spirited companions who have more than enough affection to go around for a family looking for a medium-to-large dog. Originally bred as fishing and hunting companions, they are excellent swimmers and retrievers.

German Shepherd.colors: Black and Tan, Sable, Solid Black
German Shepherd.description: Intelligent, capable, and incredibly devoted working dogs that are happiest when given a job to do. They excel in police work, search and rescue, and as service dogs.

Bulldog.description: Docile, willful, and friendly dogs that are known for their loose, wrinkled skin and distinctive pushed-in nose. Despite their tough appearance, they are gentle and affectionate companions.

Poodle.description: Intelligent, active, and proud dogs that come in three size varieties and are known for their hypoallergenic coat. They excel in obedience and agility competitions.

Beagle.description: Friendly, curious, and merry dogs that are excellent family companions and hunting partners. They have an excellent sense of smell and are often used in airport security.

Chihuahua.description: Graceful, charming, and sassy little dogs that are the smallest breed in the world. They are known for their big personalities and loyalty to their owners.

Boxer.description: Bright, fun-loving, and active dogs that are known for their playful nature and distinctive square jaw. They are excellent family dogs and natural protectors.

Golden Retriever.description: Intelligent, friendly, and devoted dogs that are one of the most popular family breeds. They excel as therapy dogs, guide dogs, and in search and rescue.

Pug.description: Charming, mischievous, and loving dogs that are known for their distinctive wrinkled face and curly tail. They are excellent companion dogs and adapt well to apartment living.

Rottweiler.colors: Black with rust to mahogany markings
Rottweiler.description: Loyal, loving, and confident guardian dogs that are known for their strength and protective nature. They are excellent working dogs and family protectors.

Affenpinscher.colors: Black, Gray, Silver, Red, Black and Tan
Affenpinscher.description: Often described as 'monkey-like', these small dogs are known for their intelligence and bold personality. Despite their small size, they are fearless and make excellent watchdogs.

Afghan Hound.colors: Various including black, cream, red, and blue
Afghan Hound.description: Known for their elegant appearance and long, flowing coat, Afghan Hounds are ancient sighthounds that hunt by sight rather than scent. They are independent and dignified companions.

Akita.coat: Double coat, straight and harsh outer coat
Akita.colors: Various including white, brindle, and pinto
Akita.description: Powerful and dignified, the Akita is known for its unwavering loyalty. In Japan, they symbolize good health, happiness, and long life. They are protective of their families and wary of strangers.

Alaskan Malamute.colors: Various shades of gray and white, sable and white, black and white
Alaskan Malamute.description: Originally bred for hauling heavy loads in harsh Arctic conditions, Malamutes are powerful, affectionate dogs with incredible endurance. They are friendly and loyal family companions.

Siberian Husky.colors: All colors from black to pure white
Siberian Husky.description: Bred as sled dogs, Siberian Huskies are known for their endurance, speed, and beautiful appearance. They're friendly, energetic dogs with a strong pack mentality that makes them great family companions.

Dalmatian.colors: White with black or liver spots
Dalmatian.description: Famous for their distinctive spotted coat, Dalmatians were traditionally used as carriage dogs. They are energetic, intelligent, and make excellent companions for active families.

Border Collie.colors: Various, black and white most common
Border Collie.description: Widely considered the most intelligent dog breed, Border Collies are tireless working dogs. Originally bred for herding sheep, they excel at dog sports and need plenty of physical and mental stimulation.

Doberman Pinscher.colors: Black, red, blue, or fawn with rust markings
Doberman Pinscher.description: Dobermans are known for their loyalty, intelligence, and athletic build. Originally bred as guard dogs, they make excellent protectors while being loving family companions when properly trained and socialized.

Great Dane.colors: Various including fawn, brindle, blue, black, harlequin
Great Dane.description: Often called 'gentle giants,' Great Danes are one of the tallest dog breeds. Despite their imposing size, they are known for their gentle and friendly nature, making them excellent family companions.

Shih Tzu.colors: Various including gold, white, black, and combinations
Shih Tzu.description: Bred to be companions, Shih Tzus are affectionate lapdogs with a regal appearance. Their name means 'lion dog' in Chinese, and they were highly valued by Chinese royalty for centuries.

Dachshund.colors: Various including red, black and tan, dappled
Dachshund.description: Known for their long body and short legs, Dachshunds were originally bred to hunt badgers (their name means 'badger dog' in German). They are bold, curious dogs with a surprisingly loud bark for their size.

Pembroke Welsh Corgi.colors: Red, sable, fawn, and black and tan, usually with white markings
Pembroke Welsh Corgi.description: Pembroke Welsh Corgis are low-set, strong, and sturdy dogs with a fox-like expression and characteristic short legs. Originally bred for herding cattle and sheep, they're intelligent and highly trainable. Despite their small stature, Corgis are energetic and require regular exercise. They're beloved for their happy, outgoing personalities and have gained popularity as the favorite breed of Queen Elizabeth II.

Australian Shepherd.colors: Blue merle, red merle, black, red, all with or without white markings and/or tan points
Australian Shepherd.description: Australian Shepherds are highly intelligent, versatile working dogs with strong herding instincts. Despite their name, they were developed in the United States for ranching work. They're known for their striking multicolored coats and often heterochromatic eyes (different colored eyes). Aussies are extremely energetic and require plenty of physical and mental stimulation, excelling at dog sports like agility and flyball.

Yorkshire Terrier.description: Originally bred to catch rats in clothing mills, Yorkshire Terriers have become popular companion dogs. Despite their small size and elegant appearance, they retain the bold, tenacious terrier personality.

Boston Terrier.colors: Brindle, seal, or black with white markings
Boston Terrier.description: Known as 'American Gentlemen' due to their tuxedo-like coat pattern, Boston Terriers are friendly, intelligent dogs with a sweet, gentle disposition. They were the first breed developed in the United States.

French Bulldog.colors: Brindle, fawn, white, and combinations with white
French Bulldog.description: French Bulldogs are compact, muscular dogs with distinctive bat-like ears and a charming, affectionate personality. They adapt well to apartment living, don't require much exercise, and make excellent companions for city dwellers. Despite their small size, they're sturdy little dogs with a gentle, patient temperament that makes them good with children.

German Shepherd Dog.colors: Black and Tan, Sable, Solid Black
German Shepherd Dog.description: Intelligent, capable, and incredibly devoted working dogs that are happiest when given a job to do. They excel in police work, search and rescue, and as service dogs.

Bernese Mountain Dog.coat: Thick, moderately long, tricolored double coat
Bernese Mountain Dog.colors: Tricolor (jet black, clear white, and rust)
Bernese Mountain Dog.description: The Bernese Mountain Dog is a large, sturdy working breed originating from the Swiss Alps, where they were used for drafting, driving, and guarding livestock. They're known for their striking tricolor coat and gentle, calm demeanor. Despite their impressive size, Berners are incredibly gentle and patient with children, making them excellent family dogs. They form strong bonds with their families and are somewhat reserved with strangers. Due to their mountain heritage, they tend to enjoy cool weather and often love playing in snow.

Shiba Inu.coat: Stiff, straight outer coat with soft, thick undercoat
Shiba Inu.colors: Red, sesame, black and tan, cream
Shiba Inu.description: The Shiba Inu is an ancient Japanese breed known for its fox-like appearance and spirited personality. They're the smallest of the native Japanese breeds and were originally used for hunting in mountainous terrain. Shibas are independent, confident dogs with a strong prey drive and can be aloof with strangers while devoted to their family. They're fastidiously clean (almost cat-like) and are known for their distinctive 'Shiba scream' vocalization when excited or unhappy.

Cavalier King Charles Spaniel.colors: Blenheim (chestnut and white), tricolor (black, white, and tan), black and tan, ruby
Cavalier King Charles Spaniel.description: Cavalier King Charles Spaniels combine the gentle, affectionate nature of a toy breed with the athleticism of a sporting spaniel. Named after King Charles II of England who adored these dogs, they're characterized by their sweet, gentle expression and silky coat. Cavaliers are excellent companion dogs, known for their friendly disposition toward everyone including children, strangers, and other pets. They thrive on human companionship and are happiest when involved in family activities.

Cocker Spaniel.colors: Various including black, golden, red, parti-color combinations
Cocker Spaniel.description: Cocker Spaniels are known for their beautiful, silky coats and sweet, gentle expressions with their trademark melting eyes. Originally bred as hunting dogs, they're now primarily family companions. Cockers are merry, outgoing dogs that bond closely with their families and generally get along well with children and other pets. Their moderate size makes them adaptable to various living situations, though they do require regular grooming to maintain their luxurious coat.

American Pit Bull Terrier.colors: All colors and patterns except merle
American Pit Bull Terrier.description: American Pit Bull Terriers are strong, athletic dogs with a reputation for courage and tenacity. Contrary to negative stereotypes, well-bred and properly socialized Pit Bulls are known for their affection toward people, eager-to-please attitude, and loyalty to their families. They're highly intelligent and respond well to positive reinforcement training. These dogs typically love children and can make excellent family pets when raised responsibly. They excel in various dog sports including weight-pulling, agility, and obedience.

Pomeranian.coat: Double coat with long, profuse outer coat and soft undercoat
Pomeranian.colors: Various including orange, red, cream, black, and parti-colors
Pomeranian.description: Pomeranians are compact, fluffy spitz-type dogs known for their fox-like expression and vibrant personality. Despite their tiny size, they descend from large working sled dogs and retain a bold, spirited temperament. Nicknamed 'the little dog who thinks he can,' Poms are confident and often behave as if they're much larger than they actually are. They're intelligent, alert watchdogs and devoted companions who bond closely with their owners, though they can be somewhat reserved with strangers.

English Bulldog.colors: Various including brindle, white, red, fawn, and piebald
English Bulldog.description: English Bulldogs are medium-sized dogs with a distinctive pushed-in nose, undershot jaw, and rolling gait. Originally bred for bull-baiting, modern Bulldogs bear little resemblance to their ancestors in temperament - today they're known for their gentle, affectionate nature. Though they may look tough with their wrinkled face and stocky build, they're typically sweet-natured and good with children. They're relatively inactive indoors and don't require extensive exercise, making them suitable for apartment living. Due to their brachycephalic (short-nosed) structure, they can be prone to breathing difficulties and overheating.
